storyInfo: Melanite goes to Honeyberry to try to recall a dream that had been plaguing her.

attributes.content: Thursday
Please, take a seat, Melanite. Make yourself comfortable. I believe this is the first time you've proactively come to me for a session?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Relax. We're just here to chat. Is there anything in particular that you want to talk about?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I'm been having... dreams.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: What kind of dreams?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I don't remember the details. All I remember is that I had a dream... and the lingering feelings pressing down on my chest.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: No memories of the dream itself... lingering feelings... When did this start?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: About a week ago. The sensation is getting stronger and lasting longer, sometimes even all day...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Are they nightmares?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: The only nightmare I ever have is of that night. Of watching the rioters approach my father, but somehow I just can't pull the trigger like he taught me to.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I would wake up sweating, my heart hammering against my chest. But since I know it's not real, I can quickly calm myself down.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: But these recent dreams... it's different. It's hard to describe, but it feels like having a piece of cotton-padded lead in my arms; soft, but heavy.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Heavy... so heavy, and the feeling lasts for so long... It's hard for me to concentrate.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Do you have any medication I could take for it?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Medication may not be the answer. I suspect your dreams involve faded memories, maybe something from your childhood you've forgotten. Do you think you'd be comfortable talking about your parents?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Sure.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I thought you would be more... reticent.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: No, not at all.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: My father used to work for Blacksteel. He had a medium, stocky build, was missing an arm, and had a little moustache.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: My mother was a housewife who worked part-time doing laundry before Dad retired, then the two of them ran the shop together. She was a little taller than my father, lanky. That's all.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: What about yourself?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Me? I was a kid. I did kid things.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Can you talk about yourself in more detail?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Melanite looks up at the yellowish light on the ceiling.
...More detail?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I went to school, helped out at home and around the shop, and played with the neighbors' kids. That's about it.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Any unforgettable memories? Sights, experiences, that sort of thing.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Nothing worth mentioning.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Well, I'd like to hear them anyway, even if it doesn't seem relevant. Anything that comes to mind.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Melanite looks around at the room's furnishings.
The light back home was yellow, just like this one. The flooring wasn't so nice, and would creak every now and then.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: The table was really high... or maybe I was just too small at the time.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: What about yourself? What did you do or think back then?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Me?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Oh, I had a scar on my knee that faded away at some point. The staircase at home must've been pretty high for me to fall.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: The light, the floor, the table, the stairs... Oh, and... the chairs.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: The chairs were...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Melanite...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I don't quite remember, but I think they were made of wood—
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: That's enough, Melanite.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Uh.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: You're just stating facts without context or emotion. Like you're talking about somebody else.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Those are just my impressions from back then.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Only facts, with no details or emotions, not even your own place in the scene... It must be hard for you.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: No, not at all.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: How so?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I want to forget what happened that night... but it all comes back so vividly whenever I have one of those nightmares.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: If I forget what happened before all that, then at least I can be indifferent. At least I can...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I'd feel less bad about losing something I don't care about.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: The life I have now has nothing to do with what happened back then. Whatever I feel or don't feel about it, it won't affect me at all.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Melanite...
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Sorry that I kept talking about things unrelated to the dreams. I guess if you don't have any pills I can take, I'll try to adjust on my own.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: No, it could be related. Maybe resolving your issues with your childhood memories will also help with—
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Sorry for worrying you. I should be going.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Melanite turns around, avoiding Honeyberry's concerned gaze, and walks out of the room.
She meant to go straight back to her dorm, but took a wrong turn out of anxiety and ended up in an unfamiliar corner.
Seeing an empty hallway, she instinctively puts her hand on her railgun's trigger, before realizing it and moving her hand away.
This is Rhodes Island. Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Even if you've never been here before, there's nothing you can't deal with... Everything here is safe. Really.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Nothing in your past has anything to do with you, Operator.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: No one here will hurt you. You're well compensated and receive proper treatment, as long as you can deliver sufficient fire support in battle.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: It's alright, it's alright...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Melanite takes a few deep breaths.
Talking to herself, taking deep breaths... How much these techniques help is debatable, but they can't hurt.
The anxiety that had climbed up her calves recedes back to her ankles.
It's okay, it's okay... Just act normal, business as usual.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: It has nothing to do with you. Detach yourself. It'll all get better.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Friday
Your regular checkup is complete, Operator Melanite. It'll be a while before the report is ready, though.
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: Okay.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Is something bothering you?
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: How... How did you...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Er... 'how did I' what?
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: I-I mean, how did you know something's bothering me? Did something come up in the checkup?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: No, I just thought you looked really pale.
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: ...I guess I didn't sleep well last night. Had a dream.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Alright, the report's ready. Let me see...
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: Hmm... Oripathy symptoms are stable, but there are various changes in other areas.
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: Looks like it's true that you've been sleeping poorly. Nightmares?
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: ...No, just ordinary dreams, really. I even had a chat with Honeyberry about them yesterday. I'm perfectly fine, and ready to work.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Work? What does work have to do with any of this?
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: Here, have some chocolate. It'll help you settle down.
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: Melanite takes the unwrapped chocolate, looking deep in thought. She takes a bite, and a bitter-sweet taste fills her mouth.
...Will my condition affect my next field mission?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Well, it's a little concerning. If you haven't gotten better by then, I would recommend a period of rest.
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: Rest...?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: No, I'll be fine by then.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Well, I'm glad you're confident, at least.
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: I'm heading to lunch. Care to join me?
attributes.name: Medical Department Operator

attributes.content: Er, thanks, but not today.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: ...I need to get better.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: How did I used to do it?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I used to keep myself busy enough that my mind didn't have time to wander.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: It'll get better.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Saturday
Instructor Dobermann.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Today's Saturday. Are you sure you don't want to take a day off?
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: No need.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I'd welcome that kind of motivation if this were the problem children of A6, but you're the type to keep pressuring yourself without accepting anybody's help.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: Plus, the results from your checkup yesterday weren't too good.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: I even had a little conversation with Honeyberry about you. I can't say I fully understand, but it's clear that you've been bothered by your dreams lately.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: You knew?!
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Keeping track of your condition is part of my job as instructor.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: I'm fine, Instructor. Really.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Did you have another dream last night?
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: Take the day off.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: Please, training is the best way for me to relieve stress.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Are you sure?
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: I'm sure.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Missed.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Missed.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Missed!
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: This isn't working at all...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I've done this so many times before, but I've never missed like this...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: The more I try to aim, the more my hand shakes. What's going on? How do I fulfill my duties like this?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Time's up!
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I let everyone down.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: It's solo training. Who exactly are you letting down?
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: Come on, have some warm milk.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: What I mean is... I'll only be a burden on missions if this keeps up.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: You don't need to worry about that.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: You mean... operators in poor condition won't even be sent on missions?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: To put it bluntly, yes. Field missions can be dangerous.
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: And an operator in bad form can't be trusted with them?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: Sorry, but I need to go. Thanks for the milk.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Melanite? Melanite!
attributes.name: Dobermann

attributes.content: Sunday
As she opens her eyes, she feels the familiar sensation of the dream filling her chest for a fleeting moment.
If she takes a moment to savor it, the soft yet heavy feeling seems almost poignant.
It is not the bloody pain of having your arm cut off.
It is the sorrow of remembering, long after the injury has healed, that you once used your hands to cover a friend's eyes one afternoon, long ago.
Now, however, Melanite does not have the luxury of analyzing the subtle and difficult-to-describe emotions.

All she knows is that her dreams have disrupted every aspect of her life, made her anxious, given others cause for concern and made them give her special treatment... Left unchecked, they would eventually make her a worthless invalid.
Rhodes Island may be kind, but how long would they tolerate an invalid?
Huh?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Why would you think like that, Melanite? That's not how his works!
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Is it not?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: My relatives supported me because we're connected by blood.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: They greeted me warmly because my grades were good.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: My previous employer paid me because I could test weapons that others couldn't.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Rhodes Island employs me and gives me treatment because I can provide fire support with this railgun...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I know it's disrespectful to compare you to them, but who would help a worthless invalid?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: ...Your parents.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: They loved you unconditionally, didn't they? Otherwise, why would you be so upset about losing them?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Just stop right there, Honeyberry, please. All I want is a quiet and peaceful life. I don't need unconditional love. It's enough that I can earn a living with my own two hands.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: You can't allow... No, you can't pretend that the memories of the past are but a distant shadow, just because you feel sad when you remember them.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Maybe your subconscious defensive mechanisms are detaching you from your past emotions without you even realizing it. But that doesn't mean they've gone away.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: They're just tucked away in a corner, hidden from your consciousness. But you can't remain detached and run away forever.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: If you're worried about these dreams ruining your life, then running away will only make it worse.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: But... what can I do? I can't go on like this.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Rhodes Island doesn't fire people just because they have mental health issues. You can trust me on that.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Maybe people need a reason to love someone, but you certainly don't need one to show kindness.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Just spend the rest of the day doing whatever you want, okay?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: I'll get you something to drink. There are books here, if you want to read.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: 'The warm air rising from the cup melted the white frost on the window. The subtle, tender scent calmed my mind...'
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: 'Firewood cracked in the fireplace opposite the armchair, seemingly causing the air in the room to rise and expand, like soft bread...'
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: No... I can't even read a book.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Melanite brings the cup of warm cystymilk towards her mouth.
Before it touches her lips, the poignant sensation in her chest suddenly grows sharply.
(The smell of cystymilk? I had a little bit when I was with Instructor Dobermann, too...)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: (No, it's not just cystymilk... there's something else.)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: (But why would I feel like there's something else? Have I smelled something recently?)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: (Maybe... there's something near my room?)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Honeyberry, I... I need to step out for a bit.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Sure. I'll be here all day. Come back anytime you want.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: (Here it is, my room... There's a faint smell... but it's not coming from inside. It's from over there...)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: (Here it is. Just one floor from my room.)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: (The smell's coming from that unremarkable door in the corner. I can probably find out what's going on by going inside.)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: (But what if...)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: What if whatever's inside makes you feel like a fool?
You and I, we worked so hard to forget those painful memories... Unconsciously, you shoved all those colors, smells, and emotions onto me and detached yourself.
Just so you could feel better, so you wouldn't think back to happier times when you're alone, so you could clench your teeth and keep going.
Go back, Melanite. There's nothing to see here. You don't know, but I do, and it's absurdly simple.
Emotions, memories, they're nothing more than burdens to you.
But I'm already at my limit.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Don't believe those people. Did you really think you would get better? They're just doing the job they're paid for, whispering sweet lies into your ear. What do they care what happens to you afterwards?
Then what do you want me to do?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Go back.
I need to... I need to know what I'm dreaming about.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: What if what's inside doesn't have anything to do with your dreams, or your past, or your life?
You said you knew!
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Do you really want to let all our efforts over all these years go to waste?
Are you really going in?
Melanite pulls the door open.
The voice like her own no longer speaks, instead merging into the smell coming from the room.
...Instructor Dur-nar?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Melanite?!
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Dur-nar is holding a hot drink in her hands.
This smell...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: What are you doing here? Did Medical send you?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: No... I just smelled something like a drink.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Whew, you gave me a fright there.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: So what is it?
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: A kind of powdered drink mix with milk. Real nutritious. It used to be carried in grocery stores all across Columbia about a decade ago, but you can hardly find it all these days. Took a lot of effort to get my hands on this.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: But you can have some if you want. I haven't touch this cup yet.
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: Melanite takes the cup with a blank look on her face, feeling the warmth in her hands and trying to pinpoint the deep sorrow that the sweet scent has stirred within her heart.
The memories float to the surface, but years of evasion have made their surface cold and smooth.
She tries to reach towards the source of the sorrow that seems so incongruous with the sweetness, yet it lingers just out of reach.
She takes a sip of the light brown liquid in the cup.
As her tongue senses the sweetness, those memories dissolve in water, with the sweet scent of chocolate and cystymilk emanating from the surface.
In the reflection, she sees herself holding a warm drink in her hand.
In the cup, she finds the time that she lost, and is found in turn by the time she once thought discarded.
She hears an unfamiliar yet familiar voice from the cup.
Look at this, Breonna.
attributes.name: Father's Voice

attributes.content: This drink powder is selling like crazy. This was the last box, and people kept asking me to sell it, but... this one's for my little girl, and it's not for sale.
attributes.name: Father's Voice

attributes.content: What's the matter? You're just holding the cup.
attributes.name: Father's Voice

attributes.content: That's because the cystymilk's still too hot for her. Isn't that right, Breonna?
attributes.name: Mother's Voice

attributes.content: Yeah, it's too hot!
attributes.name: Breonna

attributes.content: I'm waiting for it to cool down!
attributes.name: Breonna

attributes.content: Two faint silhouettes with the scent of chocolate and cystymilk emerge from the vapor.
You always liked Daddy's guns, right Breonna? C'mon, let's head out of town and—
attributes.name: Father's Silhouette

attributes.content: She's eight, you dumb oaf!
attributes.name: Mother's Silhouette

attributes.content: Look, I've only got the one hand, and it's holding the gun. It's not even loaded, not a single etched bullet.
attributes.name: Father's Silhouette

attributes.content: Fine, fine, but at least let her finish her drink.
attributes.name: Mother's Silhouette

attributes.content: Then, places that had long been reduced to mere words in Melanite's memory.
I thought you didn't bring any etched ammo, Daddy.
attributes.name: Breonna

attributes.content: Just because your Daddy only has one arm doesn't mean he can't hide something when he puts his mind to it.
attributes.name: Father's Silhouette

attributes.content: Here, I'll hold your hand. Focus on the feel of casting...
attributes.name: Father's Silhouette

attributes.content: Whoa, you're a natural! Took me half a month to fire my first shot.
attributes.name: Father's Silhouette

attributes.content: But you still need practice. Shooting a gun isn't easy, and without practice, you might not be able to pull it off when it counts.
attributes.name: Father's Silhouette

attributes.content: Finally, all the haziness begins to clear up.
The carefree childhood she must have had emerges from the teacup with shades of brown and white, along with the Breonna from before she became Melanite.
I thought that powdered drink would keep selling, but I guess it was just a fad. Now it's all just sitting in the storeroom.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: We can't cut the price any further, but it's taking up so much space.
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: I-I like it! I'll drink it every day!
attributes.name: Breonna

attributes.content: Breonna?
attributes.name: Mother

attributes.content: Her father was more than just a stocky man with one arm and a moustache. He could be impulsive, but he loved his little girl dearly, partly out of guilt for not being there for her as an infant.
Her mother was more than just a lanky housewife. Everything in the household revolved around her firm voice and deft hands. She was strict with her daughter, but just as loving.
As for Breonna... She grew from a young child filled with questions about everything when her father first came home, to a girl only a little shorter than her father.
At some point she stopped getting taller, but she thought those days would continue forever.
That's the last of the drink... Have you been drinking even more when we're not looking? That's a lot of calories to work off, you know.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: But thanks to you, we managed to turn our losses around and keep this little grocery store going. You're our lucky star.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: We'll always love you, no matter what. And we'll always be together.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Goodnight, Breonna. Dream a dream of chocolate.
attributes.name: Father

attributes.content: Goodnight, Breonna. Dream a dream of chocolate.
With that, her father went downstairs. And after that bloody night, she locked all that sweetness away in a forgotten corner of her memories, whether consciously or unconsciously.
What she lost was so precious that she had wished she never had it.
Until now.
Melanite? Are you ok? Are you... crying?
attributes.name: Dur-nar

attributes.content: (Fights back sobbing)
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: I-It's okay, Instructor, I just... I remembered what I had forgotten...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Monday
(Blows nose) I feel so happy for you, Melanite.
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: By the way, I was asked to deliver something to you.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: To me?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Melanite takes out a little cardboard box.
The assorted dried berries from Rim Billiton that Instructor Dur-nar promised you.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: Oh? Have you started working for Dur-nar's Snack Network?
attributes.name: Honeyberry

attributes.content: Yup.
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: To remember even more lost flavors, and recall more lost memories...
attributes.name: Melanite

attributes.content: To bring back the time I lost.
attributes.name: Melanite
